intro: Gagea aurea, commonly known as the golden gagea, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas. It blooms in early spring and is often found in regions with mild, temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
